Virtual Reality at Berkeley

14 May 2015

Born of a hackathon idea, last Spring some friends and I founded Virtual Reality at Berkeley .

Making Something From Nothing

The idea of creating a club dedicated to Virtual Reality was first proposed to me by Daniel Pok one Sunday afternoon in a Pieology. After a lot of hesitation, we decided to move forward.

(I'm the one middle, back-row with the blue shirt in awe at an unpowered Oculus.)

We were three guys with a Google cardboard, an idea, and not enough free time. But after a semester of school, hours of meetings, and many emails begging professors, we had officially become a registered club under the name "Virtual Reality at Berkeley". I wanted to be called "Daydreams" but my club-mates did not share my vision.

We connected with existing research groups on campus so we actually had VR stuff to do. I was lucky enough to be able to work with a Drone group on campus who wanted to use AI to navigate rooms. SO. COOL.

I'm no longer with VR@B since I decided my main interests lied in other fields, but I'm very grateful for the work my friends put and continue to put into the club.
